newsitem.title: UK: LME copper resumes uptrend in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LME copper resumes uptrend in late trading.

text.p: LME copper hit fresh two-month highs in late inter-office trading on Tuesday evening, challenging a new resistance level.
Three months copper bounced from its kerb close of $2,045 per tonne and sailed through its earlier intra-day high of $2,057 to be indicated at $2,060/65 by 1900 GMT.
"There were some stops over $2,060," one dealer said, adding that the high trade so far had been at $2,066.
The next resistance level was pegged at $2,070, the high of September 4.
The other metals were little changed with aluminium at $1,455/57 per tonne compared to a kerb close of $1,454.50.
